content.text: AngularJS AJAX - $http
$http is an AngularJS service for reading data from remote servers.
content.html: $http is an AngularJS service for reading data from remote servers.

content.text: AngularJS $http
The AngularJS $http service makes a request to the server, and returns a response.
content.html: The AngularJS $http service makes a request to the server, and returns a response.

content.code_html:
<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">

<p>Today's welcome message is:</p>
<h1>{{myWelcome}}</h1>

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http.get("welcome.htm")
  .then(function(response) {
    $scope.myWelcome = response.data;
  });
});
</script>

content.text: Methods
The example above uses the .get method of the $http service.
content.html: The example above uses the .get method of the $http service.

content.text: The .get method is a shortcut method of the $http service. There are several shortcut methods:
content.html: The .get method is a shortcut method of the $http service. There are several shortcut methods:

content.text: The methods above are all shortcuts of calling the $http service:
content.html: The methods above are all shortcuts of calling the $http service:

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http({
    method : "GET",
      url : "welcome.htm"
  }).then(function mySuccess(response) {
    $scope.myWelcome = response.data;
  }, function myError(response) {
    $scope.myWelcome = response.statusText;
  });
});

content.text: The example above executes the $http service with an object as an argument. The object is specifying the HTTP method, the url, what to do on success, and what to do on failure.
content.html: The example above executes the $http service with an object as an argument. The object is specifying the HTTP method, the url, what to do on success, and what to do on failure.

content.text: Properties
The response from the server is an object with these properties:
content.html: The response from the server is an object with these properties:

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http.get("welcome.htm")
  .then(function(response) {
    $scope.content = response.data;
    $scope.statuscode = response.status;
    $scope.statustext = response.statusText;
  });
});

content.text: To handle errors, add one more functions to the .then method:
content.html: To handle errors, add one more functions to the .then method:

content.code_html:
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http.get("wrongfilename.htm")
  .then(function(response) {
    // First function handles success
    $scope.content = response.data;
  }, function(response) {
    // Second function handles error
    $scope.content = "Something went wrong";
  });
});

content.text: JSON
The data you get from the response is expected to be in JSON format.
content.html: The data you get from the response is expected to be in JSON format.

content.text: JSON is a great way of transporting data, and it is easy to use within AngularJS, or any other JavaScript.
content.html: JSON is a great way of transporting data, and it is easy to use within AngularJS, or any other JavaScript.

content.text: Example: On the server we have a file that returns a JSON object containing 15 customers, all wrapped in array called records .
content.html: Example: On the server we have a file that returns a JSON object containing 15 customers, all wrapped in array called records.

links.text: Click here to take a look at the JSON object.

content.text: Click here to take a look at the JSON object.
content.html: Click here to take a look at the JSON object.

<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="customersCtrl">

<ul>
  <li ng-repeat="x in myData">
    {{ x.Name + ', ' + x.Country }}
  </li>
</ul>

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('customersCtrl', function($scope, $http) {
  $http.get("customers.php").then(function(response) {
    $scope.myData = response.data.records;
  });
});
</script>

content.text: Application explained:
The application defines the customersCtrl controller, with a $scope and $http object.
content.html: The application defines the customersCtrl controller, with a $scope and $http object.

content.text: $http is an XMLHttpRequest object for requesting external data.
content.html: $http is an XMLHttpRequest object for requesting external data.

content.text: $http.get() reads JSON data from https://www.w3schools.com/angular/customers.php .
On success, the controller creates a property, myData , in the scope, with JSON data from the server.
content.html: On success, the controller creates a property, myData, in the scope, with JSON data from the server.
